Articles.Content:
I tried searching for an image file that I could edit to change the look of Kerbin, but I couldn\'t find one. I want to edit it to put a red circle or something around the KSC so that I can see it from space.

Is this possible?
Im not sure how kerbin is textured. Hmmm, time to dig through some files. If its not an image im not sure. Could just be hiding.
actually, no. Kerbin is created proceduraly (by code), not an image file.
The textures of grass and rock might be able to be changed, but IDK.
So the textures are generated with it? Hmmm.

I was hoping it would be an image mapped onto the planet model. Really I just want a nice KSC marker that I can see from space. I have a tiny ship that I landed behind the launch tower which is acting as my marker right now, but I don\'t really want to see the craft icon in the map view. (Picky, I know =P)
The purple icon on the navball points to the KSC, and it\'s opposite icon points away, would that help you?

The purple icon on the navball points to the KSC, and it\'s opposite icon points away, would that help you?

I\'m aware of that, but it\'s only of so much help for me. I\'ve been messing around with the Satellite Relay plugin and it\'s really helpful when setting up satellites to be able to see where KSC is in map view. My current solution is a tiny ship landed right beside KSC, but I have too many active flights as it is. (I wish you could scroll that 'active flights' list)
